page.title: 01The Tollerton Area
page.content: The area around Tollerton is low and rather flat.There are many farms and a little woodland. Tollerton is a small village in an agricultural area of North Yorkshire, ten miles North West of York,four miles South West of Easingwold and thirteen miles South East of Thirsk. The Domesday entrance for Tollerton reads as follows:-"In Tolentun eight carucates to be taxed and there may be four ploughs.Saint Peter had and now has in the demesne two ploughs and six villeins and two bordars with two ploughs".Tollerton is in the ecclesiastical parish of Alne with Aldwark. Running half a mile East of Tollerton is the River Kyle which flows into the River Ouse further South.Tollerton is one mile to the west of the A19 that goes from York to Thirsk.
